rev.comment: /* Prehistory: Occupy Wall Street and Occupy Cal */
rev.diff:
Line 1: Line 1:
'''Occupy UC Davis''' is an ongoing series of [[Occupy Movement]] demonstrations at [[UC Davis]]. It is distinguished from the off-campus but allied [[Occupy Davis]]. Occupy UC Davis gained international attention on November 18, when University police were filmed pepper-spraying a group of protesters as they were peacefully seated.<ref>CS Monitor [http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2011/1119/UC-Davis-pepper-spray-smear-tactics-Occupy-protests-face-rougher-response UC Davis Pepper-Sprays Protestors]</ref>
'''Occupy UC Davis''' is an ongoing series of [[Occupy Movement]] demonstrations at [[UC Davis]]. It is distinguished from the off-campus but allied [[Occupy Davis]]. Occupy UC Davis gained international attention on November 18, when University police were filmed pepper-spraying a group of protesters as they were peacefully seated.<ref>CS Monitor [http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2011/1119/UC-Davis-pepper-spray-smear-tactics-Occupy-protests-face-rougher-response UC Davis Pepper-Sprays Protestors]</ref>
==Prehistory: Occupy Wall Street and Occupy Cal==
==Prehistory: Occupy Wall Street and Occupy Cal==
  +
==Police violence at Occupy Cal==
  +
On November 9, students and professors at UC Berkeley began with a series of "teach-ins" around campus, a noon rally and march. Approximately 1,500 demonstrators attended the days' events. <ref name=10KGO>{{cite news|last=Hollyfield|first=Amy|title=Occupy Cal calm, but ready for showdown|url=http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local/east_bay&id=8426365|accessdate=13 November 2011|newspaper=KGO-TV|date=10 November 2011}}</ref> When protestors set up seven tents to symbolize their support for [[Occupy Movement]]. In response, law enforcement officials from UC Berkeley Police, the [[Alameda County Sheriff's Office]] and other UC Police officers in [[riot gear]] arrived to remove the seven tents from the protest site. <ref>{{cite news|last=Asimov|first=Nanette|title=Occupy Cal protesters vote to strike on Tuesday|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/11/10/MNH21LT6ND.DTL|accessdate=13 November 2011|newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle|date=11 November 2011}}</ref> <ref name=SF2>{{cite news|last=Asimov|first=Nanette|title=UC campus police move in on student protesters|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/11/10/BA861LSR8G.DTL|accessdate=13 November 2011|newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle|date=10 November 2011}}</ref>
  +   +
Video footage of the afternoon confrontation showed police beating protesters with batons and dragging two protesters by the hair, one of whom was UC Berkeley English professor [[Celeste Langan]]. <ref>{{cite news|last=Gollan|first=Jennifer|title=UC Berkeley Pledges to Investigate Police Response to Occupy Cal Protest|url=http://www.baycitizen.org/occupy-movement/story/uc-berkeley-pledges-investigate-police/|accessdate=13 November 2011|newspaper=The Bay Citizen|date=11 November 2011}}</ref> 39 protesters including Professor Langan were arrested for charges including "resisting and delaying a police officer in the performance of their duties, and failure to disperse when given a dispersal order."<ref>{{cite news|last=Bowe|first=Rebecca|title=Occupy Cal makes its dramatic entrance|url=http://www.sfbg.com/politics/2011/11/10/occupy-cal-makes-its-dramatic-entrance|accessdate=13 November 2011|newspaper=San Francisco Bay Guardian|date=10 November 2011}}</ref>
==November 18==
==November 18==
